THE CHAPTER 22.2.3 IS UPDATED ACCORDINGLY: 22.2.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK ORLY AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED TO THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIME AND ESTIMED LANDING TIME, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN-ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DIFFERENT TYPES OF DPI AND API ARE: -GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) -PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (P-DPI) -EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) -TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) -ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) -CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER TO BE USED REA AS IT IS REPLACED BY DPI MESSSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. REF AIP AD2 22.2.3

RESULTS IN THE MODIFICATION OF THE SB CONVENTIONAL DEP PROC BASED ON THIS AID.TEMPO OPR PROC ARE IMPLEMENTED IN ORDER TO HANDLE THE SB DEP ACFT, WHILE AWAITING THE DESIGN OF NEW RNAV STD INITIAL DEP PROC - ALL SID PTV DEP LFPB ARE REMOVED. - ALL SIDS USING POY DEP FM LE BOURGET ARE AFFECTED BY THE EXTINCTION OF NDB POY. SOME INITIAL PARTS OF SID MONOT AND DORDI DEP FM LFPB ARE NOT AFFECTED AND THEREFORE REMAIN USABLE.THE NEW WP OXCEL REPLACES POY AND MUST BE INPUT IN NAVIGATION SYSTEMS OF AIRPLANES DEPARTING FROM LE BOURGET THAT USE THESE ROUTES. ******************************** DEP 07/09 TO OLZOM / MONOT WITH SID LFPB 5J IN FORCE - SID CONV MONOT 5J NOT USABLE - SID DORDI 5J REMAINS USABLE - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW DEP SID CONV DORDI 5J CMB 3000 FT AMSL, UP TO D 17.1 NM FM MLN, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OLZOM OR MONOT - RADIOCOMMUNICATION FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW DEP SID CONV DORDI 5J CMB 3000 FT AMSL, UP TO D 17.1 NM FM MLN, THEN PCD DCT OLZOM OR MONOT COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP 07/09 TO OLZOM / MONOT WITH SID LFPB 5M IN FORCE - SID DORDI 5M NOT USABLE - SID MONOT 5M REMAINS USABLE IN ITS INITIAL PART UP TO RADIAL 073 TSU INCLUDED. - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID MONOT 5M CMB FL 070, THEN INTERCEPT AND FLW THE 073 TSU (MAG 253), THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM OR MONOT OR DORDI - PARTS OF SID MONOT 5C / 5F AND DORDI 5C / 5F ARE NO LONGER USABLE AFT 12 NM FM BT. - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID CONV MONOT 5C OR 5F CMB 4000 FT AMSL ON RADIAL BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT MAG 123 THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - REF AD2.22.5.1.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK : READ : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DPI AND API ARE OF DIFFERENT TYPES : GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER USED AND REPLACED BY DPI MESSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. INSTEAD OF : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DPI ARE OF DIFFERENT TYPES : EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER USED AND REPLACED BY DPI MESSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT.'

SX0031/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFMN/NICE/COTE EXPERIMENTATION OF 4 INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURES TO FACILITATE OPTIMIZED DESCENTS. VALIDITY: 18APR24 - 25DEC24 THIS AIP SUP CONCERNS THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT OF OPTIMIZED DESCENT PROFILES ON THE INITIAL APPROACHES (INA = INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURE) OF FLIGHTS INBOUND FOR NICE COTE D AZUR (LFMN). AN OPTIMIZED DESCENT MEANS A DESCENT WITH REDUCED FUEL CONSUMPTION AND NOISE POLLUTION (TO DESCEND CONTINUOUSLY, TO THE GREATEST POSSIBLE EXTENT, BY EMPLOYING MINIMUM ENGINE THRUST, IDEALLY IN A LOW DRAG CONFIGURATION, PRIOR TO THE FINAL APPROACH POINT). THROUGHOUT THE VALIDITY PERIOD OF THIS AIP SUP, AND WHEN CONDITIONS ALLOW (TRAFFIC, WEATHER, ETC.), THE CONTROLLER USES THE PROCEDURES PUBLISHED IN ORDER TO LIMIT RADAR VECTORING. THE CREWS, WITH THE INFORMATION OF THE DISTANCE REMAINING TO THE RUNWAY MUST PERFORM OPTIMIZED DESCENTS AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT WILL TAKE PLACE AT ANY TIME (DAY OR NIGHT), DURING LIGHT TRAFFIC SITUATION, ONCE THE AIRCRAFT HAS BEEN TRANSFERRED TO NICE APP. IF THE TRAFFIC SITUATION DOES NOT ALLOW THE USE OF THE TRAJECTORIES,THE PILOT SHOULD EXPECT RADAR VECTORING TOWARDS THE INITIAL FIX OF THE PROCEDURE IN USE. RNAV(GNSS) PROCEDURES: RWY04R RAPOT1M/1N RWY04L LEMPU1M/1N RWY04L/R BISBO1M/1N RWY22L/R SOTOX1M/1N

FOR OVERFLIGHTS OR ARRIVALS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED BY THE PILOT, WITH SUFFICIENT NOTICE (BETWEEN 10 AND 25 MINUTES BEFORE ENTERING THE CRNA), TO ENSURE THAT THE CONNECTION IS ESTABLISHED, AND WITH THE FIRST FRENCH ACC CROSSED. IF LOGON HAS ALREADY BEEN ESTABLISHED WITH AN ADJACENT UPSTREAM ACC PROVIDING LOGON FORWARD, OR IF FORWARD HAS FAILED, ADVANCE NOTICE IS NOT REQUIRED. FOR FLIGHTS DEPARTING FROM FRENCH AIRFIELDS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED NO LATER THAN CROSSING FL150. IF LOGON IS IMPOSSIBLE FOR A TECHNICAL REASON KNOWN OR UNKNOWN TO THE E PILOT, THE CREW WILL ANNOUNCE 'UNABLE CPDLC'. REFERENCE AIP FRANCE GEN 3.4-9.

Paragraph.Text: AX0002/20 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR THE PILOT OF THE AIRCRAFT OPERATING IN THE LIBYAN AIR SPACE A. THE LIBYAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY STRESSES THE PILOT OF AIRCRAFT OPERATING OUTSIDE THE FIELD OF HIGH COMMUNICATIONS FOR THE NECESSITY OF USING VHF/ RT RANGE .RADIO FREQUENCY ASSIGNED TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION BETWEEN PILOTS VHF AIR / AIR VOLINTARY REPORT. B. FOR MORE COORDINATION BETWEEN THE OPPOSING AIR TRAFFIC, ESPECIALLY THOSE OPERATING OUTSIDE THE CONTROLLED AIRSPACE, IN ORDER TO ENSURE THE SAFETY OF AIR NAVIGATION IN THE LIBYAN AVIATION TERRITORY AND THE MENTIONED RADIO FREQUENCIES ARE: 1- WHEN FLYING AT OR BELOW THE FLYING LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 123.5 MHZ 2- WHEN FLYING ABOVE A FLIGHT LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 126.9 MHZ C. THIS AUTHORITY ALSO STRESSES THE NEED TO OBTAIN PRIOR PERMISSION FOR FLIGHTS BEFORE TAKING OFF FROM AIRPORTS THAT ARE NOT SUBJECT TO THE MAJOR AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL CENTERS IN TRIPOLI AND ITS BRANCH IN BENGHAZI BY WAY OF HIGH-FREQUENCY RADIO
